text: Mario Arnaldo Gómez Castellanos (born August 12, 1981 in Tela, Honduras) is a Honduran footballer. ==Club career== Gómez played for New Jersey Stallions, Vida and Victoria, before joining F.C. Motagua in summer 2009.Ronmel y Cabrita nuevos refuerzos de Motagua - El Heraldo He most recently played for F.C. Motagua in the Honduran football league.Castillo pasó la "escoba" por Motagua He won a sub-championship with The Eagles but could not stay more than a year due to inconsistency and lack of appearances. ==International career== Gómez made his debut for Honduras in a March 2005 friendly match against the United States, coming on as a second-half substitute for Carlos Morán. His second and final international match was a February 2006 friendly against China. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1981 births Category:Living people Category:People from Atlántida Department Category:Association football midfielders Category:Honduran footballers Category:Honduras international footballers Category:New Jersey Stallions players Category:C.D.S. title: Mario Arnaldo Gómez
